page.title: 18Religion in Great Coxwell
page.content: Religion is represented in Gt.Coxwell by St.Giles Church,a 12th century building,which is part of the estab- lished Church of England.Approximately 8% of the inhabitants worship regular- ly & the vicar also officiates at 3 other churches.There have been nine weddings,eight baptisms & five funerals during the last five years. Restoration and redecoration were carried out during the beginning of this decade.From 1875 there was a Methodist Chapel by Chapel House,it was demolished in 1953.With the close of the Chapel many of its regular worshippers then attended St.Giles. During the middle years of this century there were a few residents who were staunch Jehovah's Witnesses,but they moved away in the 1970's.
